NAME: North Fork Poudre: Eagles Nest
CATCHABLE_SPECIES: Brown trout, creek chub, sunfish, bluegill.
NOTES: water can get hot in summer
HISTORY: caught lots of aggressive creek chub, one brown trout fall 2020

NAME: Taylor River
NOTES: lots of good access points below taylor reservoir all the way to 135

NAME: Obejoyful campground
NOTES: suggested by fly shop in crested butte

NAME: Gunsight Bridge
NOTES: suggested by fly shop in crested butte

NAME: Roaring Judy SWA
NOTES: suggested by fly shop in crested butte; SWA includes fish hathcery, ponds, and east river. Not sure of exact spots where to park

NAME: Slate River Peanut Lake
NOTES: park at peanut lake, can walk downriver. Decent hole at this gps spot
HISTORY: caught a 11-12"brown, much to my surprise on large parachute adams looking thing

NAME: Slate River Skyland houses
NOTES: technically private but nice river access for dipping and fishing. Nice holes upstream of bridge. Rumoredly a pond a bit upstream housing 30" rainbows
HISTORY: lost 2 brown trout ~11" each on worm and parachute adams

NAME: Vail Forest Road 719
NOTES: lost lake trail nearby
HISTORY: rode past it on bike going to lost lake, where I saw one 3" fish in 4 hours with no strikes

NAME: Ruby van Deventer County Park
NOTES: camping spots don't rpvide a whole lot of privacy, but first come first serve spots available. Bog redwoods, right next to the smith river.
HISTORY: camped summer 2021, $20 ish, good temp, heard big splashing at night but no luck on lure

NAME: Smith River around gasquet
NOTES: Lots of river access spots driving along it from the west. Some nice holes at this GPS location
HISTORY: caught quite a few eager 6 inchers, one nice looking steehlead ~12-13 " summer 2021.

NAME: Santiam River
NOTES: suggested as a river with good fishing. No experience with this specific gps spot

NAME: Dispersed site
NOTES: spot given to me by Conor from Kitoi

NAME: Dispersed site
NOTES: spot given to me by Conor from Kitoi

NAME: Florence Keller
NOTES: County park campground, I think they have first  come first serve sites

NAME: Panther Flats
NOTES: Pretty good sized campground, most sites full from being booked on rec.gov. I think like 15 sites or so are first come first serve. There are some other campgrounds up the road but they have less FCFS sites. GPS is a bit off, further up the road a bit. On middle fork of smith
HISTORY: fished there, flows were low, nothing but 4-5"

NAME: gig harbor
NOTES: suggested as a spot for sea-run cutthroat fishing

NAME: olalla bay market
NOTES: sea-run cutthroat fishing spot
HISTORY: fished there a few hours summer 2021, saw a few risers early in the day, nothing after.

NAME: hansville Point
NOTES: suggested spot for sea-run cutts. Never been, gps spot randomly chosen

NAME: joemma beach state park
NOTES: suggested spot for sea-run cutts. Never been

NAME: McKenzie River
NOTES: heard it's good for trout and whitefish, ask a fly shop in eugene for moreq

NAME: Umpqua River
NOTES: not great river access along umpqua highway, wasn't great in low flows when I was there (algae, exposed rocks). Need more info
HISTORY: tried to fish this here on my way to eel creek campground

NAME: Rogue River
NOTES: heard it's good fishing, steelhead and other species, need more info

NAME: Mcloud River
NOTES: heard it's good fishing, steelhead and other species, need more info

NAME: Skagit River
NOTES: heard it's good fishing, steelhead and other species, need more info for more specific spots
HISTORY: drove along it summer 2021, super pretty, didn't fish it

NAME: Cedar River
NOTES: heard it's good fishing, steelhead and other species, need more info for more specific spots

NAME: WDFW North Bay Clamming Access Site
NOTES: spot for sea run cutts
HISTORY: got skunked in 30 min or so there, incredible amount of sand dollars

NAME: Owyhee River
NOTES: heard it's good trout fishing, need more info for more specific spots

NAME: Hat Creek
NOTES: heard it's good trout fishing, need more info for more specific spots

NAME: Juanita Beach Park
NOTES: on lake washington for warmwater freswhater fishing
HISTORY: saw a guy pull out a sunfish here. Got skunked myself, a bit eedy off the walkway that juts out but some deep spots.

NAME: Methow River
NOTES: good fishing, need more info for specific spots
HISTORY: fished a bit on the way to winthrop summer 2021. Good deep sectionns, some pullouts along the road. Had a smaller fish on on a a woolie bugger that popped off

NAME: Mazama Dispersed Camping
NOTES: spot up forest service road

NAME: Mazama Dispersed Camping
NOTES: spot up forest service road

NAME: Mazama Dispersed Camping
NOTES: spot up forest service road

NAME: Mazama Dispersed Camping
NOTES: Gorgeous view and spot

NAME: Stanley Dispersed Camping
NOTES: Given by Sam wood, need to go down road 633 from the west because otherwise you get cut off from a private road if you apporach from the east

NAME: Stanley Dispersed Camping
NOTES: 2 free campsites with pit toilet on salmon river. Fishing isn't great here though
HISTORY: camped summer 2021. almost died wading the river the next day, no fish

NAME: Lake Hattie
NOTES: spot given by a friend, super monster fish in here, browns and maybe rainbows

NAME: North Delaney Lakes
NOTES: spot given by a friend, super monster fish in here, browns and maybe rainbows

NAME: Stagecoach Tailwater
NOTES: well known, high trafficked spot with tons of big fish. Lot of public access and a road down from stagecoach

NAME: Mormon bend
NOTES: gps point is a bit downstream of mormon bend campground, but this is where the good fishing starts on salmon. Lots of places east of here is good too with good holes
HISTORY: saw some big cutthroats at this spot, caught some smaller rainbows on salmonfly

NAME: Yellow belly lake
NOTES: good spot in idaho..might be fish here?? Need more research

NAME: Fourth of July Lake
NOTES: bit of a hike in, but recommended by Sam P and Sam W. maybe a bit tough access road to TH

NAME: Sawtooth/Alpine Lake
NOTES: 4 miles or so in, good backpacking with awesome views and granite slabs. Big cutthrouts to be had at alpine lake outlet, golden trout as well. Brook trout at least in sawtooth lake further up.
HISTORY: sawtooth lake still forzen over mid June 2021, had a great time fishing and campung alpine lake instead.

NAME: Petit Lake
NOTES: Can drive right up, apparently gets somewhat popular in popular times. Recommended by Sam P

NAME: Snake Pit Hot Springs
NOTES: natural hot springs on Valey creek

NAME: Boat Box Hot Springs
NOTES: small tub that fits two people

NAME: Sam Billings Campground
NOTES: free campground, about 15 sites FCFS near west fork of bitterroot. Need to take forest road to it, don't follow google maps if it takes you on private road. Bring own water, but creek nearby
HISTORY: camped summer 2021. not too buggy, saw a moose

NAME: Sublett Campground
NOTES: free campground, about 5-7 sites. Pit toilets. Best one GPS'd with a spring (not sure if drinkable), shielded, and aspen grove. Dispersed camping available around reservoir and probably up the sublett road as well. Rerservoir downstream has fish, maybe browns.
HISTORY: camped summer 2021, didn't catch any fish in the reservoir

NAME: Mclendon Springs Campground
NOTES: "semi developed" campground on blm land.

NAME: Carson Lake
NOTES: check for seasonal road closures for access. Wild strawberries on the dam. Brook trout and rainbows in here maybe?

NAME: Silver Lake
NOTES: check for seasonal road closures for access. Lots of cutts and grayling.
HISTORY: last visited summer 2021, been probably 5 times

NAME: Atkinson Reservoir
NOTES: check for seasonal road closures, big lake with deep water dropping off the dam. Purple cuttbows.
HISTORY: summer 2021, caught a couple cuttbwos on lures I think

NAME: Leon Lake
NOTES: Brook trout, short walk in less than two miles. Shore access for fly fishing a bit difficult but good spots can be found. Check for seasonal road closures
HISTORY: backpacked summer 2020 with noah, each caught a few very pretty brook trout 13 inches or so

NAME: Cottonwood #4
NOTES: allegedly has tiger trout. Kind of popular for dispersed camping
HISTORY: Have been but I don't remember

NAME: Neversweat Reservoir
NOTES: some good dispersed camping spots, but no fish when last went
HISTORY: went summer 2021, overrun with fathead minnows, no risers or big fish seen. Actually some dead bigger (~12") fish were seen

NAME: Cottonwood #5
NOTES: in neversweat drainage, some good dispersed camping spots
HISTORY: went summer 2021, overrun with fathead minnows, no risers or big fish seen

NAME: Anthracite Creek
NOTES: smaller creek, supposedly good terrestrial fishing later in year. Campground at this gps point that I haven't been to

NAME: Big Dominguez Campground
NOTES: campground on big dominguex creek with small cutthroats. Brushy creek to fish with a bit of walking apparently

NAME: Pa-Co-Chu-Puk
NOTES: section of river right below ridgeway reservoir, big fish but pretty hard to catch and popular fishing spot. Walk-in tent loop on west side of river. Pond next to river full of stockers, easy to catch

NAME: Lake Katherine
NOTES: 4 miles or so in, sheer wall of rock to the west'continental divide. Can drive to TH in 2WD. Good aggressive lake trout, and brook trout in outlet (though probably not worth bringing fly rod for them).
HISTORY: backpacked fall 2020, no people in late september I think.

NAME: eel creek campground
NOTES: 40 sites or so, great sanddunes nearby and walking trails. Sites are brush-protected and feel pretty private. $25 ish reserved on rec.gov

NAME: zimmerman lake
NOTES: home to genetically pure straing of greenback cutthroats. Small hike in, apparently trailhead gets full at busy times

NAME: big south trailhead
NOTES: good spot to fish, cutthroats and brookies

NAME: Lady Moon Lake
NOTES: big rainbow stockers, most of the lake is private but some public shoreline. Need to bushwack to get there
HISTORY: fished late july 2021 with george, got skunked but can be caught on worms and green wooolly buggers

NAME: Pueblo Reservoir Tailwater
NOTES: decent trout fishery

NAME: Sackett Reservoir
NOTES: tiger trout and brooks to be had, good dropoffs on west side of lake. Weir and johnson campground right there, check for seasonal road closures
HISTORY: went summer 2021, caught tigers on terrestrials

NAME: Kitson Reservoir
NOTES: fish present, some dispersed camping spots. A bit exposed

NAME: Parvin Lake
NOTES: big rainbows, browns but water gets pretty warm. Good wading access around this gps point and southwest part of lake

NAME: Big Meadows Reservoir
NOTES: good sized brook trout with decent wading access. Disperesed camping not really available at the reservoir but spots along the road in available.
HISTORY: went summer 2021, fish were rising all the way out in middle that I couldn’t reach

NAME: Blue Lake
NOTES: decent hike in, apparently good cutthroats here.
